title: [CakePHP 4.x] belongsToMany doesn't work like in 3.x

milestone.description:
4.0.0 is an *API breaking* release. It will:

* Remove the features deprecated in 3.x.

Code that works in the latest 3.x with no deprecation warnings should work in 4.0.0 as well.

See the roadmap for more information https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/wiki/4.0-Roadmap

body:
This is a (multiple allowed):

* [x] bug
* [ ] enhancement
* [ ] feature-discussion (RFC)

* CakePHP Version: 4.x-dev - Hash: 6fec49c146.
* Platform and Target: 
PHP 7.3.9 (via FPM)
MariaDB 10.3.18
NGINX 1.14


### What you did
- Download https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/releases/tag/4.0.0-beta3 & adjust config/app.php for DB connection
- Import SQL from bellow 
- `bin/cake bake model all`
- `bin/cake bake controller all`
- `bin/cake bake template all`
- Insert "Category 1" into the categories table
- Go to the books "add" template

### What happened
It doesn't populate the dropdown with the already present "Category 1"

### What you expected to happen
It should populate the dropdown with the already present "Category 1"

# Other usefull information
In both the BooksTable.php as well as the CategoriesTable.php the `belongsToMany` connection is correctly set (in my opinion)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9105243/66233615-17f34500-e6ec-11e9-9f3a-c838ca316f16.png)

Controller and Template also contain the (in my opinion) correct code for outputting the connected tables content.

src/Controller/BooksController.php
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9105243/66233144-e7f77200-e6ea-11e9-9957-a670e6f96c78.png)

templates/Books/add.php
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9105243/66233178-fd6c9c00-e6ea-11e9-940c-ac96b8c40662.png)

But I don't get the already present "Category 1" in the dropdown on the /books/add template.

After enabling the DebugKit I recognised, that the single SQL Query being made on that template is the following:

```
SELECT 
  Books.id AS `Books__id`, 
  Books.name AS `Books__name` 
FROM 
  books Books 
  INNER JOIN books_categories BooksCategories ON Books.id = (BooksCategories.book_id) 
LIMIT 
  200
```

My question here is: Why does it inner join with the "connection table"?

I first thought this problem persist in the current CakePHP 3 version as well, but as you can see in this issue, it works there (if you generate the files in the correct order)

https://github.com/cakephp/bake/issues/587 

# SQL
```
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS books;
CREATE TABLE books
(
    id       INT UNSIGNED PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT,
    name     varchar(255),
    created  DATETIME DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    modified DATETIME DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS categories;
CREATE TABLE categories
(
    id       INT UNSIGNED PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT,
    name     varchar(255),
    created  DATETIME DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    modified DATETIME DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS books_categories;
CREATE TABLE books_categories
(
    book_id     INT UNSIGNED,
    category_id INT UNSIGNED,
    PRIMARY KEY (book_id, category_id)
);
```
